description: From nancy. As a verb, cf. prance, dance, and mince.

entries.meaning: (slang) Alternative form of nancy: an effeminate male homosexual.
examples: "Fairies, nances, swishes, fags, lezzes — call 'em what you please — should of course be permitted to earn honest livings  […]

verbs.description: nance (third-person singular simple present nances, present participle nancing, simple past and past participle nanced)

entries.meaning: (uncommon, slang) To move in a prissy or stereotypically gay way.
A large shrub or small tree of subtropical and tropical areas of the Americas, Byrsonima crassifolia, bearing a small, sweet, yellow fruit.
